keywords: TfL,trams, cashless trams, tfl, transport for london, london trams, tram tickets, tram fares, tram travel, tram Oyster, tram contactless
description: Our trams have gone cashless. Use your contacless or Oyster card, as well as travelcards and passes to pay for your journey.

texts: You can't buy a paper ticket at tram stops but there are still a number of different ways to pay for your journey:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Pay as you go with \u003ca href=\"/fares/how-to-pay-and-where-to-buy-tickets-and-oyster/pay-as-you-go/contactless-and-mobile-pay-as-you-go\"\u003econtactless\u003c/a\u003e (card or device) or an \u003ca href=\"/fares/how-to-pay-and-where-to-buy-tickets-and-oyster/pay-as-you-go/oyster-pay-as-you-go\"\u003eOyster\u003c/a\u003e card for £1.50 for a single adult journey","Travelcard including Zones 3,4 5 or 6","Bus \u0026 Tram Pass on your Oyster card","One Day Bus \u0026 Tram Pass","Paper Day Travelcard including Zones 3,4 5 or 6"]}
If you're using a contactless card, device or Oyster card, you'll need to touch in on the yellow card reader on the tram platform before boarding.
Our Hopper fare lets you take unlimited pay as you go tram and bus journeys, within one hour of touching in on your first tram or bus, for £1.50. Make sure you always use the same card to touch in.
Find out more about our bus and tram fares .
Top up your pay as you go credit, or buy Travelcards and Bus & Tram Passes:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["At your nearest \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/maps/oyster-ticket-stops?cid=ticketstopfinder\"\u003eOyster ticket stop\u003c/a\u003e ","At any \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/maps/track?intcmp=40400\"\u003eTube, London Overground or National Rail station in London\u003c/a\u003e ","By downloading the free \u003ca href=\"/fares/how-to-pay-and-where-to-buy-tickets-and-oyster/tfl-oyster-and-contactless-app\"\u003eTfL Oyster and contactless app\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Using Auto top-up means you'll never run out of pay as you go credit. When your balance goes below £20, we'll automatically top up your Oyster card with either £20 or £40 from your bank account.
Card clash happens when a yellow card reader detects two or more Oyster, contactless payment or other smartcards at the same time.
If a card reader detects more than one card:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["It doesn't know which card to take payment from","If you get a green light it could take payment from a card you did not intent to pay with","If you get a red light it means you won't have paid for your journey"]}
To avoid card clash, keep your Oyster and contactless payment cards separate and only touch the card you wish to use on the reader.
